text: I've got to tell you a kind of a funny personal story yesterday that we left the studio in such a great mood.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Everything was going so well.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Our Food for the Poor campaign, the August Food for the Poor campaign, is going really, really well.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And we had a great day yesterday.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: I mean, we started out the morning at like 11,000 in contributions.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Food for the Poor is this Christian ministry that we partner with.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: A few times a year, we try to make a difference in people's lives.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: We try to save lives.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: This audience – and this comes from my wife, Denise.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Years ago, Denise said, why don't you take your show and the big audience you have and try to do some good, not just yapping about issues, but make a difference in people's lives.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And that's why we have all these great partnerships with Prison Fellowship and the Angel Tree Christmas campaign.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: We've done –
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Salvation Army, all kinds of partnerships over the years.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And we love Food for the Poor.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: They are a worldwide Christian ministry.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And they give starving children food.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: They save lives.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: They provide clean drinking water.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So yesterday, I made a mistake.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: I said, and let me tell you what the mistake was.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: I said, I'm feeling a little superstitious today.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: We've got a goal of $40,000 in the Food for the Poor campaign.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: $100 will feed a hungry child two nutritious meals a day for an entire year and provide their village with clean drinking water.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Okay, $100.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: That's all I need.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And we're at $11,000.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: I said, you know what?
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: If we can get...
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: a big number today and get over, say, $20,000 in donations, I'll bet we're going to win on November 5th.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: I tried to tie it together.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And somebody from South Carolina sent me a text.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: This is why I love South Carolina, because people there are so smart.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And the person said, you know, Mike, when you flirt with superstition like that, you're doing exactly the opposite of what is godly.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: You're doing the polar opposite of God and faith.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Turn it over to the Lord.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And that person was right.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So I said that on the air.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Well, anyhow, I got home last night, and the counter, if you go to MikeOnline.com and click on the Give Life banner at the top of the page, you'll see the total.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And right now it says 44,000 of 40,000 goal reached.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: We're 4,000 over the goal, right?
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: Not so right.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: There was one donor yesterday that I saw on the list, a guy, I think his name was David or Don, had a $10,000 donation.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: And I called Food for the Poor and I said, I want to call him and thank him personally for that incredibly generous donation.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So they called him to get permission for me to make a phone call to him, which is the right thing to do.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: The poor guy almost had a heart attack.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: He didn't make a $10,000 donation.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: He was trying to make a $100 donation and he put the decimal point in the wrong place.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: So last night, what I thought was $35,000 of our $45,000 goal was really only $25,000.
speaker: SPEAKER_18

text: We lost $10,000 because of that honest mistake.

text: Are you looking for a way to make a lasting, positive impact in the lives of children who need it most?
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: Milton Hershey School in Hershey, Pennsylvania is hiring married couples to become house parents.
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: MHS is one of the world's best private schools, where students in pre-K through 12th grade live on campus and receive an exceptional education with all costs covered.
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: Houseparents are an important part of our mission to create life-changing opportunities for students from disadvantaged backgrounds.
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: In this role, you and your spouse will work together to create a nurturing environment for the group of students in your care.
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: You will care for their daily needs while providing mentorship and teaching valuable life skills.
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: While it's important you feel called to this role, it's not a volunteer position.
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: This is an opportunity to find your purpose as a difference maker while living rent-free and earning an income with comprehensive benefits.
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: You'll be part of a community of over 200 houseparent couples and an even larger MHS support system, all united by the goal of helping children become the best versions of themselves.
speaker: SPEAKER_12

text: If you're a married couple looking to discover your next chapter, visit mhskids.org to learn more.
